full_summary:
**Tender Announcement**
======================

**Title** (English) / [**Titre** (Français)]
------------------------

High Density Mobile Shelving / [Rayonnages mobiles à haute densité]

**Reference Number** / [N° de référence]
-----------------------------------

PW-__HN-446-81465

**Notice Classification** / [Classement de l'avis]
-----------------------------

Request for Proposal / [Demande de propositions]

**Public Works and Government Services Canada**
---------------------------------------------

Public Works and Government Services Canada invites bids from qualified suppliers to provide Supply Arrangement (SA) services for high-density mobile shelving (HDMS) systems, including relocation, modification, extension, and consultation services.

**Documentation**
----------------

This tender follows the closure of a previous solicitation (E60HN-21HDMS/B) to allow new suppliers to become qualified and for existing suppliers with a valid supply arrangement to participate in this new solicitation.

The scope of work includes:

* Renewal of the existing Supply Arrangement for HDMS systems' relocations, modifications, and consultations
* Installation of new HDMS systems in all regions of Canada, excluding Nunavut and areas subject to Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs)

**Key Dates**
-------------

* Bid Opening Date: 2026-12-15
* [Début date de livraison prévue]

**Security Requirements**
----------------------

* Trade Agreement: CETA, WTO-AGP, CPTPP, CFTA, and FTAs with Peru, Colombia, Panama, Korea, and UK
* Clause: Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement (CLCA) – No requirement

**Language**
------------

This solicitation can be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Submission of Bids**
---------------------

Interested parties may submit their bids following the instructions outlined in the documentation package provided.

**For further information**
-------------------------

Please contact Garcia Lozano, Contracting Authority at:

Gatineau, Quebec  K1A 0S5

This Notice is provided in English and French. In the event of a dispute, the English version takes precedence.
